title: I'm trying to write a story and I'm having trouble with writing natural dialogues. Are there any methods or books that you can recommend? - Quora

response.answer_text: I like to write small stories as a hobby, but I also had trouble with dialogue. But I decided to start looking at how writers wrote dialogue and also study how people talk in real life. I also began trying to apply some training into real life and try engaging and in conversations as naturally and smoothly as I can. Sometimes, it’s okay to botch up a dialogue a bit just as long as you know you can go back and fix it. Don’t know if this is the answer you were looking for, but writer to writer: always look far ways to improve yourself and your style.
Hi! Dialogue: the Art of Verbal Action for Page, Stage and Screen by Robert McKeeDynamic Dialogue: Letting Your Story Speak by William Bernhardt
